function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of big data analytics may lead to over-reliance on technology and neglect of human input in decision-making.","Impact":"Inaccurate or incomplete data analysis may lead to misguided decision-making and ineffective strategies for controlling the spread of infectious diseases.","Mitigation":"Ensure that human expertise and judgment continue to play a significant role in decision-making alongside the use of big data analytics.","Technologies":"Human expertise, decision-support systems that integrate human input with big data analytics.","People":"Government officials, policymakers, and healthcare professionals.","Owner":"Government, data science consultancy firms, healthcare organizations."},{"Description":"Monitoring compliance using AI and internet-connected devices may infringe on privacy rights and civil liberties of citizens.","Impact":"Violation of privacy rights and civil liberties may lead to public mistrust and resistance to government regulations, undermining the effectiveness of containment measures.","Mitigation":"Implement strict data privacy regulations and transparent communication with the public about the purpose and use of surveillance technologies.","Technologies":"Data encryption, anonymization, and strict access control mechanisms for collected data.","People":"Citizens, privacy advocates, and civil liberty organizations.","Owner":"Government, law enforcement agencies, and technology providers."},{"Description":"Predicting the spread of coronavirus and planning healthcare capacity based on data analysis may result in insufficient consideration of social and behavioral factors that influence disease transmission.","Impact":"Inadequate consideration of social and behavioral factors may lead to underestimation of healthcare resource demand and ineffective allocation of resources for controlling the spread of the virus.","Mitigation":"Incorporate social and behavioral analysis into healthcare capacity planning and resource allocation, and ensure collaboration between data analysis experts and public health professionals.","Technologies":"Social network analysis tools, behavioral modeling software, and collaboration platforms for data analysis and public health professionals.","People":"Public health professionals, data analysis experts, and policymakers.","Owner":"Healthcare organizations, data analysis firms, and government agencies."}]}
